title: Schumer, Pelosi staff to continue talks with Treasury on Thursday about interim emergency coronavirus relief bill
text: The talks come as the $349 billion fund for small businesses, called the Paycheck Protection Program, is quickly being wiped out.

title: Unemployment benefits are a lifeline. They're not easy to get.
text: CNN's Jon Sarlin talks with two recently laid off workers who have been unable to file for unemployment benefits.

title: Stocks slide as dire economic outlook weighs
text: World stock markets fell on Thursday, while bonds and the dollar held on to hefty gains, after a coronavirus-driven plunge in U.S. retail sales and factory production and increasing gloomy economic outlooks for Asia.

title: Are Struggling Bank Stocks Pointing to Another Financial Crisis?
text: S&P 500 Index (top pane) vs Bank Index to S&P 500 Ratio (lower pane) As most investors know, the banks play a big role in the overall economy. Healthy banks tend to mean a healthy economy and struggling banks tend to mean an uneven or faltering economy.

title: Bad news on the economy all we’re likely to see — for now
text: On Tuesday the stock market rallied nicely because people — at least market commentators — perceived that there was good news about the virus. And they ignored the bad news — lots of it, and not just perceived bad news — about how hard coronavirus had hit the US and world economies.

title: Oil bounces back as rising stockpiles seen pointing to lower output amid coronavirus
text: Oil rose on Thursday, with U.S. crude rebounding from near-20-year lows in the previous session on hopes that a big build-up in U.S.

title: U.S. Weighs Paying Drillers to Leave Oil in Ground Amid Glut
text: The Trump administration is considering paying U.S. oil drillers not to pump at all and that could mean compensation for companies to sit on more than 360 million barrels worth of reserves. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Mike McGlone discusses the oil market on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: JPMorgan's Kolanovic makes bold market call
text: JPMorgan's Marko Kolanovic has a bold call for the markets, post-coronavirus. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

title: Options Markets Offer Ominous Outlook For Stocks
text: Stock investors might getting ahead of themselves as the current rally in US stocks stalls.  We take a look at the options market to get more insights on what to expect.

title: U.S. stock futures slide as investors brace for jobless-claims report
text: U.S. stock index futures fell late Wednesday, following losses on Wall Street and ahead of a sure-to-be-ugly U.S.

title: Once economy reopens, how will businesses know what consumers want?
text: Gladys Kong, Ubermedia, on how businesses will determine what it is that consumers want once the country begins to reopen.

title: Looking for upside during an ugly earnings season? Here's where Crossmark's Victoria Fernandez would go
text: Crossmark Global Investments' Victoria Fernandez sees opportunities in coronavirus-battered areas of the market.

title: Why You Shouldn't Try To Time 'Market Lows'
text: Investors have the best intention to 'Sell Low and Buy Lower' during bear markets, conserving capital to buy at market lows.

title: Trump unveils COVID-19 economic recovery council
text: President Donald J. Trump announced the leaders of the new COVID-19 economic recovery council, just as he revealed that the United States would halt funding for the World Health Organization. Yahoo! Finance's Jessica Smith joins The Final Round to discuss the latest.

title: Jim Cramer: You'll want to own currently 'toxic' stocks when coronavirus is beaten
text: "This virus is not invincible, people, and when we do beat it, you'll wish you owned some stocks, especially the ones that are currently toxic to your portfolio," Cramer said.

title: Jim Cramer: 'Suddenly, stock picking seems a lot more appealing'
text: Sometimes, trying to buy an index fund and mirror the market is a bad strategy, the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Markets: US stock futures down following weak economic data and corporate earnings
text: US stock futures were down in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the Dow and S&P logged their worst trading day since April 1.

title: Jim Cramer: 18 Stock picks worth owning here over the S&P 500
text: "Rule number one for the new abnormal is that you stick with the winners and you leave the raggedy rest to the others," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Ray Dalio on the Economic Impact of the Coronavirus Crisis
text: Ray Dalio, the billionaire founder of investment management firm Bridgewater Associates, talks with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker on the "Bloomberg Invest Talks" webcast about the long-term economic implications of the coronavirus crisis and what can be expected moving forward.

title: Schwab's Sonders Sees Downward Pressure on the Dollar
text: Liz Ann Sonders,Charles Schwab chief investment strategist, says she expects more downward pressure on the dollar.

title: Trump: Data Suggest U.S. Passed Peak on New Virus Cases
text: President Donald Trump says he sees signs the coronavirus is plateauing in parts of the country, and that he will announce on Thursday guidelines to relax stay-at-home rules. He speaks at a White House briefing. (Excerpt.)

title: Dow futures fall 100 points as investors await key jobless claims data
text: Futures contracts tied to the major U.S. stock indexes fell in the overnight session as investors awaited key jobless claims data.

title: What’s Ahead: Will Trillions Of Stimulus Dollars Ignite Inflation?
text: Where is all the stimulus cash coming from? And will Washington’s approach lead to devastating inflation and another economic crisis?

title: Why It’s Still Too Early To Give Up On The Current Stock Market Rally
text: After the sell-off and negative economic news in the stock market today, many investors are questioning if this stock market rally will hold. The IBD Live Team analyzes the strength of the rally and explains why it may be too early to give up on it just yet.

title: ETFs to watch amid coronavirus market volatility
text: Ben Johnson, Morningstar's Director of Global ETF Research, joins Yahoo Finance's Seana Smith to break down which ETFs you should be watching amid the coronavirus market volatility and more.

title: Another 5 million unemployment claims could be tallied, but the job-loss trend may be peaking
text: The number of workers filing for unemployment claims could again top 5 million for the week ended April 11, but the filings may also be peaking.

title: Crude plunges below $20 as demand dries up
text: Crude hits its lowest level in more than 18 years. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

title: Why retail is critical to the economy
text: We all know how critical the consumer is to the economy, contributing around 70% of GDP. That spending, still happens in stores the majority of the time it varies from retailer to retailer, but ~85% of aggregate retail sales are IN STORES. If the majority of physical stores are closed right now, the majority of sales are lost.

title: Trump will announce guidelines on reopening the economy Thursday
text: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that data suggested the county had passed the peak on new infections with coronavirus, and said he would announce "new guidelines" for reopening the economy at a news conference on Thursday.

title: Fed Gives Banks a Break to Keep Markets Calm, Asking for Little in Return
text: The Federal Reserve is giving banks room to maneuver with regulatory tweaks. But it isn’t barring them from paying dividends, fueling concerns that it is ignoring the lessons of the last crisis.

title: Man who moves markets makes bullish call amid coronavirus chaos
text: JPM's Marko Kolanovic sees stocks returning to all-time highs as early as the first half of next year.

title: Economist explains how the US can avoid a depression
text: The coronavirus pandemic has pushed the US into a recession according to Stifel's Chief Economist Lindsey Piegza.

title: Stocks fall on worse-than-expected economic data
text: Dismal data, banking blues and and crude's collapse all weigh on stocks.

title: U.S. companies reeling from coronavirus fallout, Fed survey shows
text: U.S. companies have been battered by the fallout from the novel coronavirus outbreak, with economic activity plunging at an unprecedented speed over the past few weeks, a Federal Reserve report released on Wednesday showed.

title: US Indexes Close Lower Wednesday (April 15)
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 23,504.35 on Wednesday with a loss of 445.41 points or -1.86%.

title: Markets dragged down by abysmal retail sales and factory output
text: US major stock indexes fell in Wednesday trading as new data from the Commerce Department and Federal Reserve indicated a collapse in manufacturing output and retail sales. However, the declines did not completely erase yesterday’s gains in another sign that US investors and corporations may be better positioned to withstand the economic shocks caused by […]

title: Ariel Investment co-CEO on state of the markets
text: Mellody Hobson, Ariel Investment co-CEO, joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the state of the markets.

title: Dow Jones Today: Stocks Doomed By Dour Economic Data
text: One of the big themes emerging due to the novel coronavirus outbreak is the impact the virus is having on economic data and how equity markets are reacting to that news. As Wednesday's market action suggests, poor economic data is likely to be met with ugly stock market response.

title: Stay focused on long-term objectives, allocations: WFC's Ann Miletti
text: Ann Miletti, Wells Fargo Asset Management head of active equity, joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the state of the markets.

title: Goldman Sachs Predicts 37 Million Jobs Lost By The End Of May
text: As the coronavirus crisis wears on, the bank expects another 5.5 million claims will be reported tomorrow morning.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Wednesday (April 15)
text: Stocks were under pressure as dismal economic data and weak bank earnings dented market sentiment.

title: 'I fear US investors too sanguine about big cap names': Pro
text: Steve Sosnick, Interactive Brokers chief strategist, joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the state of the markets.

title: Dow closes 400 points lower after bleak economic data reflects coronavirus impact
text: U.S. stocks declined for the second time in three days following the release of March economic data that showed efforts to combat the coronavirus epidemic were taking a greater toll than feared.

title: US, European and Asian Markets Down on Wednesday
text: U.S. stocks were in the red on Wednesday on the back of economic data that showed retail sales and manufacturing output declined in March.

title: Stocks Fall, Dow Tumbles 400 Points After Retail Collapse And Weak Bank Earnings
text: Stocks reversed gains from earlier this week.

title: Cellphone tracking shows coronavirus damage to US economy
text: The millions of bits of cellphone data tracked by analytics firm Unacast show the economic impact of the coronavirus spreading across the US like a deep freeze — long-distance travel was hit early on, but eventually overall retail foot traffic slowed to a crawl, too. As the US started shutting down to fight the coronavirus.

title: Wall Street falls after gloomy economic data, bank earnings
text: U.S. stocks fell on Wednesday as dismal economic and first-quarter earnings reports compounded concerns over the extent of damage from the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Bridgewater's Dalio Sees Virus Pandemic Causing $20 Trillion Hit to Global Economy
text: Ray Dalio, the billionaire founder of investment management firm Bridgewater Associates, says.

title: Why Are Big Financial Institutions Almost Always Bullish?
text: A previous discussion of  Seth Klarman (Trades, Portfolio)’s "Margin of Safety" centered around the idea that even big, well-funded and well-staffed financial institutions can make investing mistakes, and that they are by their very nature inclined toward behaviors that are not value-adding in the long term.

title: Unicorn layoffs keep piling up as the economy gets worse
text: Earlier today a grip of new data presented a sharply negative picture of the American economy. And this afternoon, news broke that a trio of well-known, heavily-backed unicorns were cutting staff.
